pullRequest.body:
- the disjoint union of smooth manifolds is a smooth manifold
- the interior and boundary are the disjoint union of the interior and boundary; the disjoint union of boundaryless manifolds is boundaryless

A future PR will prove that `Sum.inl` and `Sum.inr` between `C^n` manifolds are C^n.

From my bordism theory branch.

---

nodes.body: This reads nicer as a bare `dsimp`; I only squeezed for robustness. If you think a bare `dsimp` is better, I'll happily revert :-)
For `dsimp` I think there's less of a robustness concern. I'd prefer the unsqueezed one.

This lemma belongs in core: `Init.Data.Sum.Basic`. @kim-em Do you have a preference for a good interim location?
(Of course, I'd replace the aesop proof by something expanded.)
Looking forward to seeing a splitting PR here sometime! :-)
Good idea, but let's do that in a different PR :-)
Name and statement are flipped wrt each other.

What do you think of
```suggestion
    I.IsInteriorPoint (.inl x : M ⊕ M') := by
```

Also below.

pullRequest.title: feat: the disjoint union of smooth manifolds

feat: Sum.inl and Sum.inr between smooth manifolds is smooth
